required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Does the Use of Fiasp vs. Asp Lead to the Prolonged TIR in Children With Type 1 Diabetes?
clinical_study.official_title: Does the Use of Faster Insulin Aspart vs. Aspart Lead to the Prolonged Glycemic Time in Range in Children Suffering From Type 1 Diabetes Who Use Continuous Glucose Monitoring?

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to assess whether the implementation of faster insulin aspart in children with Type 1 diabetes treated with intensive insulin therapy with the use of an insulin pump and using Real Time Continuous Glucose Monitoring (RT-CGM) systems leads to prolonged time in range (TIR) compared to insulin aspart.

primary_outcome.measure: Glycaemia difference in time in range (TIR) 70-180mg/dl
Glycaemia difference in time in range (TIR) 70-180mg/dl

secondary_outcome.measure: Glycaemia difference in time below range (TBR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at weeks 4 and 8 of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Glycaemia difference in time above range (TAR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at weeks 4 and 8 of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Glycaemia difference in the coefficient of variation (CV)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at weeks 4 and 8 of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in the average glycemia levels + standard deviation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at weeks 4 and 8 of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in Total Daily Dose (TDD) of insulin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at weeks 4 and 8 of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in the basal rate of insulin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at weeks 4 and 8 of the study

arm_group.description: Patients will use the continuous subcutaneous insulin infusion of insulin aspart (Novo Rapid, Novo Nordisk) and RT-CGM for 4 weeks.
Patients will use the continuous subcutaneous insulin infusion of insulin faster aspart (Fiasp, Novo Nordisk) and RT-CGM for 4 weeks.

intervention.description: Duration of the study: 10 weeks. It is assumed that the patients will attend 4 visits in Pediatric Diabetology Clinic, and 3 telephone consultations. W0: The study will start with a 2-week run-in period in order to normalize glycemia. W1: RT-CGM will be inserted. Subsequently, the participants will be randomly assigned to one of two groups (Fa-A or A-Fa), basing on which the order of insulin use will be determined. W2: after 2 weeks, diabetology telephone consultation (washout period). W3: after 2 weeks, diabetology consultation. Changing insulin type according to the allocation. W4: after 2 weeks, diabetology telephone consultation (washout period). W5: after 2 weeks, diabetology telephone consultation. W6: the results obtained throughout the study will be discussed with the patient and the parent.

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Pediatric Diabetology and Pediatrics, Pediatric Teaching Clinical Hospital of the Medical University of Warsaw, Poland
